intro: Trichomanes commutatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf maidenhair fern, is a delicate fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in width. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its fronds are usually evergreen and exhibit a unique, intricate structure. Trichomanes commutatum is known for its ability to grow on rocks and tree trunks, making it a common epiphyte in humid climates.
